title: Provides that limited liability for persons held jointly liable shall not apply to parties held liable for failing to provide reasonable security
summary: Provides that limited liability for persons held jointly liable shall not apply to parties held liable for failing to provide reasonable security or failing to provide security required by federal, state or local law, rules or regulations.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          335

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of A. PAULIN, LANCMAN, MAYERSOHN, HOOPER, ROSENTHAL,
         COLTON -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M.  of  A.  BOYLAND,  PERRY,  PHEFFER,
         TITONE -- read once and referred to the Committee on Judiciary

       AN ACT to amend the civil practice law and rules, in relation to limited
         liability of persons jointly liable

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 1602 of the civil practice law and rules is amended
    2  by adding a new subdivision 14 to read as follows:
    3    14. NOT APPLY TO ANY PERSON WHO OWNS, MANAGES, AND/OR CONTROLS PROPER-
    4  TY WHO IS FOUND TO HAVE FAILED TO PROVIDE SECURITY AS REQUIRED  BY  LAW,
    5  RULE OR REGULATION.
    6    S  2. This act shall take effect immediately and shall apply to causes
    7  of action commenced or pending on or after such date.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02544-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the civil practice law and rules, in relation to limited liability of persons jointly liable
